fields.Title: Helen - EasterEggs / Flow – WHIRLING / KIM DOOR
fields.condition: gates.IsDayFrom(3)  and  gates.IsHourBetween(21,4)  and  Variable["whirling.kimdoor_reached_knocking_hub"] == false  and  instructions.TimeSinceKimWentToSleep() >= 15

fields.Dialogue Text: Your hear the sound of a drawer closing followed by the shuffling of feet.
Where is he? Isn't it party o'clock?
Your hear the sound of a drawer closing followed by the shuffling of feet.
"Do you wanna go for a midnight drive, to clear our heads?"
"Very funny. What do you want?"
"Isn't it always party time with you?"
"It's party time."
Anything to not face the hanged disco man yet...
You're going to have to figure this one out on your own.
"Well, I don't know either. You should get some rest."
Is *he* not worried that you might have missed something in the autopsy?
"Bad dreams?"
Is *he* not worried that you didn't get the body down?
"Yes, that's a good idea. Let's do it in the morning. You know, when we're not sleeping."
"To clear our heads from what, *sleep*?"
"I don't know, Kim."
Knock.
"What is it, officer?" The lieutenant's voice sounds tired.
fields.Alternate1: "What is it, Harry? What time is it?" The lieutenant's voice sounds tired.

fields.Dialogue Text: The lieutenant's door is closed.
Still no response.
"You'll get used to them, I promise. Sometimes it helps to go for a short walk."
"I wanted to go over the case again."
I should stop bothering Kim. [Leave.]
"Is that you, detective?"
fields.Alternate1: "Is that you, Harry? What time is it?"

fields.Dialogue Text: "Good night, detective."
Your hear the sound of a drawer closing followed by the shuffling of feet.
"Yes, what is it? What time is it?"
[Leave.]
No response.
Tap out the tune Kim whistled on the swing set.
Knock again, as before.
Is *he* not worried that you haven't found the murder weapon yet?
"It's Garte, the barkeep."
What are you doing?
Doesn't he want to go for a little drive?
Bang on the door.
No, thou art Garte.
Knock again.
"I'm... not ready to go to sleep yet."
"It is I, Garte, Manager of this Faire Cafeterium."
Sleep is what he needs most right now.
